14// clang-format off
15#define GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
16 V(zero_reg) V(ra) V(tp) V(sp) \
17 V(a0) V(a1) V(a2) V(a3) V(a4) V(a5) V(a6) V(a7) \
18 V(t0) V(t1) V(t2) V(t3) V(t4) V(t5) V(t6) V(t7) V(t8) \
19 V(x_reg) V(fp) \
20 V(s0) V(s1) V(s2) V(s3) V(s4) V(s5) V(s6) V(s7) V(s8) \
21
22#define ALWAYS_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
23 V(a0) V(a1) V(a2) V(a3) V(a4) V(a5) V(a6) V(a7) \
24 V(t0) V(t1) V(t2) V(t3) V(t4) V(t5) \
25 V(s0) V(s1) V(s2) V(s3) V(s4) V(s5) V(s7)
26
27#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
28#define MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V)
29#else
30#define MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) V(s8)
31#endif
32
33#define ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
34 ALWAYS_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
35 MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V)
36
37#define DOUBLE_REGISTERS(V) \
38 V(f0) V(f1) V(f2) V(f3) V(f4) V(f5) V(f6) V(f7) \
39 V(f8) V(f9) V(f10) V(f11) V(f12) V(f13) V(f14) V(f15) \
40 V(f16) V(f17) V(f18) V(f19) V(f20) V(f21) V(f22) V(f23) \
41 V(f24) V(f25) V(f26) V(f27) V(f28) V(f29) V(f30) V(f31)
42
43#define FLOAT_REGISTERS DOUBLE_REGISTERS
44#define SIMD128_REGISTERS(V) \
45 V(w0) V(w1) V(w2) V(w3) V(w4) V(w5) V(w6) V(w7) \
46 V(w8) V(w9) V(w10) V(w11) V(w12) V(w13) V(w14) V(w15) \
47 V(w16) V(w17) V(w18) V(w19) V(w20) V(w21) V(w22) V(w23) \
48 V(w24) V(w25) V(w26) V(w27) V(w28) V(w29) V(w30) V(w31)
49
50#define ALLOCATABLE_DOUBLE_REGISTERS(V) \
51 V(f0) V(f1) V(f2) V(f3) V(f4) V(f5) V(f6) V(f7) \
52 V(f8) V(f9) V(f10) V(f11) V(f12) V(f13) V(f14) V(f15) V(f16) \
53 V(f17) V(f18) V(f19) V(f20) V(f21) V(f22) V(f23)
54// clang-format on
55
56// Note that the bit values must match those used in actual instruction
57// encoding.
58const int kNumRegs = 32;
59
60// CPU Registers.
61//
62// 1) We would prefer to use an enum, but enum values are assignment-
63// compatible with int, which has caused code-generation bugs.
64//
65// 2) We would prefer to use a class instead of a struct but we don't like
66// the register initialization to depend on the particular initialization
67// order (which appears to be different on OS X, Linux, and Windows for the
68// installed versions of C++ we tried). Using a struct permits C-style
69// "initialization". Also, the Register objects cannot be const as this
70// forces initialization stubs in MSVC, making us dependent on initialization
71// order.
72//
73// 3) By not using an enum, we are possibly preventing the compiler from
74// doing certain constant folds, which may significantly reduce the
75// code generated for some assembly instructions (because they boil down
76// to a few constants). If this is a problem, we could change the code
77// such that we use an enum in optimized mode, and the struct in debug
78// mode. This way we get the compile-time error checking in debug mode
79// and best performance in optimized code.
80
81// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
82// Implementation of Register and FPURegister.
83
84enum RegisterCode {
85#define REGISTER_CODE(R) kRegCode_##R,
86 GENERAL_REGISTERS(REGISTER_CODE)
87#undef REGISTER_CODE
88 kRegAfterLast
89};
90
91class Register : public RegisterBase<Register, kRegAfterLast> {
92 public:
93 static constexpr int kMantissaOffset = 0;
94 static constexpr int kExponentOffset = 4;
95
96 private:
97 friend class RegisterBase;
98 explicit constexpr Register(int code) : RegisterBase(code) {}
99};
100
101// s7: context register
102// s3: scratch register
103// s4: scratch register 2
104#define DECLARE_REGISTER(R) \
105 constexpr Register R = Register::from_code(kRegCode_##R);
106GENERAL_REGISTERS(DECLARE_REGISTER)
107#undef DECLARE_REGISTER
108
109constexpr Register no_reg = Register::no_reg();
110
111int ToNumber(Register reg);
112
113Register ToRegister(int num);
114
115// Assign |source| value to |no_reg| and return the |source|'s previous value.
116inline Register ReassignRegister(Register& source) {
117 Register result = source;
118 source = Register::no_reg();
119 return result;
120}
121
122// Returns the number of padding slots needed for stack pointer alignment.
123constexpr int ArgumentPaddingSlots(int argument_count) {
124 // No argument padding required.
125 return 0;
126}
127
128constexpr AliasingKind kFPAliasing = AliasingKind::kOverlap;
129constexpr bool kSimdMaskRegisters = false;
130
131enum DoubleRegisterCode {
132#define REGISTER_CODE(R) kDoubleCode_##R,
133 DOUBLE_REGISTERS(REGISTER_CODE)
134#undef REGISTER_CODE
135 kDoubleAfterLast
136};
137
138// FPURegister register.
139class FPURegister : public RegisterBase<FPURegister, kDoubleAfterLast> {
140 public:
141 FPURegister low() const { return FPURegister::from_code(code()); }
142
143 private:
144 friend class RegisterBase;
145 explicit constexpr FPURegister(int code) : RegisterBase(code) {}
146};
147
148// Condition Flag Register
149enum CFRegister { FCC0, FCC1, FCC2, FCC3, FCC4, FCC5, FCC6, FCC7 };
150
151using FloatRegister = FPURegister;
152
153using DoubleRegister = FPURegister;
154
155using Simd128Register = FPURegister;
156
157#define DECLARE_DOUBLE_REGISTER(R) \
158 constexpr DoubleRegister R = DoubleRegister::from_code(kDoubleCode_##R);
159DOUBLE_REGISTERS(DECLARE_DOUBLE_REGISTER)
160#undef DECLARE_DOUBLE_REGISTER
161
162constexpr DoubleRegister no_dreg = DoubleRegister::no_reg();
163
164// Register aliases.
165// cp is assumed to be a callee saved register.
166constexpr Register kRootRegister = s6;
167constexpr Register cp = s7;
168constexpr Register kScratchReg = s3;
169constexpr Register kScratchReg2 = s4;
170constexpr DoubleRegister kScratchDoubleReg = f30;
171constexpr DoubleRegister kScratchDoubleReg1 = f31;
172// FPU zero reg is often used to hold 0.0, but it's not hardwired to 0.0.
173constexpr DoubleRegister kDoubleRegZero = f29;
174
175struct FPUControlRegister {
176 bool is_valid() const { return (reg_code >> 2) == 0; }
177 bool is(FPUControlRegister creg) const { return reg_code == creg.reg_code; }
178 int code() const {
179 DCHECK(is_valid());
180 return reg_code;
181 }
182 int bit() const {
183 DCHECK(is_valid());
184 return 1 << reg_code;
185 }
186 void setcode(int f) {
187 reg_code = f;
188 DCHECK(is_valid());
189 }
190 // Unfortunately we can't make this private in a struct.
191 int reg_code;
192};
193
194constexpr FPUControlRegister no_fpucreg = {kInvalidFPUControlRegister};
195constexpr FPUControlRegister FCSR = {kFCSRRegister};
196constexpr FPUControlRegister FCSR0 = {kFCSRRegister};
197constexpr FPUControlRegister FCSR1 = {kFCSRRegister + 1};
198constexpr FPUControlRegister FCSR2 = {kFCSRRegister + 2};
199constexpr FPUControlRegister FCSR3 = {kFCSRRegister + 3};
200
201// Define {RegisterName} methods for the register types.
202DEFINE_REGISTER_NAMES(Register, GENERAL_REGISTERS)
203DEFINE_REGISTER_NAMES(FPURegister, DOUBLE_REGISTERS)
204
205// LoongArch64 calling convention.
206constexpr Register kCArgRegs[] = {a0, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7};
207constexpr int kRegisterPassedArguments = arraysize(kCArgRegs);
208constexpr int kFPRegisterPassedArguments = 8;

211constexpr Register kReturnRegister1 = a1;
212constexpr Register kReturnRegister2 = a2;
213constexpr Register kJSFunctionRegister = a1;
214constexpr Register kContextRegister = s7;
215constexpr Register kAllocateSizeRegister = a0;
216constexpr Register kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister = a0;
217constexpr Register kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister = t0;
218constexpr Register kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister = t1;
219constexpr Register kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister = t2;

222constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister = a2;
223constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallTargetRegister = kJSFunctionRegister;
224constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallNewTargetRegister = a3;
225constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallExtraArg1Register = a2;

227constexpr Register kRuntimeCallFunctionRegister = a1;
228constexpr Register kRuntimeCallArgCountRegister = a0;
229constexpr Register kRuntimeCallArgvRegister = a2;
230constexpr Register kWasmInstanceRegister = a7;
231constexpr Register kWasmCompileLazyFuncIndexRegister = t0;
232constexpr Register kWasmTrapHandlerFaultAddressRegister = t6;

235constexpr Register kPtrComprCageBaseRegister = s8;
236#else
237constexpr Register kPtrComprCageBaseRegister = no_reg;

240constexpr DoubleRegister kFPReturnRegister0 = f0;
